Having a striking resemblance to Taj Mahal, the Bibi ka Maqbara is often referred to as the Taj of the Deccan. Bibi ka Maqbara was constructed by Azam Shah, son of Aurangzeb in the memory of his mother Dilras Banu Begum. It is the principal monument in the historic city of Aurangabad.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: INR 10 per person (Indians and Citizens of SAARC and BIMSTEC Countries ), INR 250 per person (Foreigners)
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week except Tuesday: 7:00 AM - 6:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Cave 34 is an unfinished four-pillared hall with a shrine. Another place called Samvatsarana is located in Ellora caves which was used by thirthankaras preached after attaining omniscience.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit during pleasant weather, sunrise, sunset and favourable seasons amid day hours
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Daulatabad aka Devagiri is a town which includes the Devagiri Daulatabad fort which carries the distinction of remaining undefeated in battle. It is a 14th century fort city in Maharashtra state of India about 16 kilometers northwest of Aurangabad. Earlier the place was called Devagiri when it was an important uplands city along caravan routes but the times later have reduced it to a village. However it is also considered to be one of the seven wonders of Maharashtra and a developing tourist spot.
The Jama Masjid is located near Killa Arrak. Five rows of ten polygonal pillars are connected by a system of arches. It is therefore a very intellectually constructed structure.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Rs. 5 per person for Indians and Rs. 100 per person for Foreign tourists
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 7 AM - 6 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Panchakki is a water mill located in the dargah complex at Baba Shah Musafir Dargah, Auranagabad. It is an ancient mill which used to grind grain for the pilgrims who visited the Dargah. This mill displays the scientific thought process behind medieval Indian architecture, as in those days, it was designed to generate energy via water which was brought down from a spring on a nearby mountain. The complex, along with the mill, also consists of a mosque, a madrissa, a kacheri, a minister's house, a sarai and houses for zananas.
Once a popular monument, it now finds itself converted into a museum built of lime & stone. It stores rare collections of pottery, art, dresses, etc.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: INR 10 per person (Indians and Citizens of SAARC and BIMSTEC Countries ), INR 250 per person (Foreigners)
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week except Tuesday: 7:00 AM - 6:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The 12 Buddhist Caves mostly include viharas or monasteries. In these caves, several monasteries have shrines that are carved with paintings and sculptures of Buddha, Bodhisattva and Saints.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week-10:00AM-7:00PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A well maintained garden, elaborate with trees, flowers and an aquarium, rides, and a zoo, this one is ideal for some relaxed time in lush green and refreshing surroundings.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 7:00 AM - 10:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Every place has a distinct bazaar, so does Aurangabad. Amongst all the famous and well known ones, Gul Mandi is the largest bazaar in Aurangabad.
The Dargah was built in the memory of Pir Ismail, a tutor to the then Mughal ruler, Aurangzeb.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Mondays-10:30AM-12:00PM; Tuesday-Sunday-10:30AM-8:30PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Himroo Factory falls on your list of essentials if you wish to take back home some conventional and traditional Himroo fabric, shawls and saris.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: At a distance of 24km from Aurangabad is this astonishingly beautiful garden with fountains, fluted pillars & massive domes.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: best time to visit Jan , Feb, Mar,
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Cannaught place or market is developing as a good market for almost everything. It has good multiplex, Prozone Mall, showrooms for cars, gold ornaments SHOWROOMS, market for mobile phones, and almost everything people need in day to day life, with plenty of flats and multi storied buildings.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: INR 10 per person (Indians and Citizens of SAARC and BIMSTEC Countries ), INR 250 per person (Foreigners)
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week except Tuesday: 7:00 AM - 6:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: While Ajanta and Ellora caves are known as the world famous Buddhist monuments, they are a testimony to the fact that the three religions Hinduism, Jainism and Buddhism were one and hence there are also Hindu temples to visit here.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: An elaborate palace with 4 entrances, this structure was built on the Mughal king, Aurangzeb's order. The throne room of Aurangzeb can be found here.

Surrounded by a beautiful view, one can also finds themselves spotting a number of birds here, given the bird sanctuary in the area. During the monsoons and winter months, boating facility is also available.
If time permits, one can also visit other places of interests such Pitalkhora, Naukonda palace, Damri mahal, Paithan and Chauki-ki- masjid could be visited.

cityListData.cityIntro: Formerly known as Calicut, Kozhikode was the Capital of Malabar during the Zamorin rule 500 years ago and is famous for its centuries old trade in cotton and spices with Jews, Arabs, Phoenicians and Chinese.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: daytime
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Kozhikode,alsoknown as Calicut is a small little town on the Malabar coast. As with most of Kerala, this place is also known for its backwaters. However,apart from backwaters, the beaches around this region can also be visited for a change.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit in the mornings and evenings
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Kappad or locally known as Kappakadavu, is a famous beach near Kozhikode (Calicut), India, where the Portuguese explorer Vasco Da Gama landed on 20 May 1498. His voyage established the sea route from Europe to India. This heralded the arrival and permanent route from Europe to India. This heralded the arrival and permanent presence of various European merchant companies, leading to eventual domination and rule by the East India Company and later the period of British colonial rule.

Kappad or locally known as Kappakadavu, is a famous beach near Kozhikode (Calicut), India, where the Portuguese explorer Vasco Da Gama landed on 20 May 1498. His voyage established the sea route from Europe to India. This heralded the arrival and permanent route from Europe to India. This heralded the arrival and permanent presence of various European merchant companies, leading to eventual domination and rule by the East India Company and later the period of British colonial rule.

Said to be built on the remains of a shipwreck, the Thikkoti Lighthouse is one of the major attractions of Kozhikode. Located on a rocky shoreline, the place is best known for the scenic views it offers as well as several species of nomadic birds.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 12:00 AM - 12:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Located at the mouth of the Chaliyar River, 10 km from Kozhikode, Beypore Beach is famous for its Ship building yard more than 1500 years old. During the trading days of Arabs and Chinese, and later the Europeans, this was one of the most important fishing harbours.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit :Oct to May
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Beypore, an ancient port town in Kozhikode formerly called as Vaypura / Vadaparappanad. The famous ruler of Mysore, Tipu Sultan, named the town "Sultan Pattanam".Beypore port was historically famous for trading with the Middle East. It is one of the oldest ports in Kerala. (br) The place is also popular for building wooden ships, called as dhows in Malyalam, usually bought by Arab merchants for trading purposes but now used as tourist ships. It is also said that Sumerian ships might have been built in Beypore. Beypore used to have direct trade links with Mesopotamia since the time of silk route.

If you are a Raja Ravi Varma fan, then this museum is definitely your paradise. And if not, you can still appreciate the Indian themed paintings using western style techniques of oil on canvas and the life-like form of European Art.
Home to over 100 species of animal-life; Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary is famous for the wide variety of fresh water fishes that can be sighted in the river here.

Surrounded by a lake on one side, and a river on the other, Elathur is a quaint little village with serene surroundings. The place is also a paradise for seafood lovers as you will be served with some of the best seafood, fresh-water fishes and toddy to complete the beach-side experience.

Canoli Canal, also called the Elathur Kallai canal was commissioned by the former collector of Malabar, R. Canolly. Its construction was completed in the year 1848 and it was till 1950 that it remained a busy trading port.
Now reminiscent of the bygone era of timber trade, the Kallai river once fed the timber hub- the second largest timber trading centre in Asia after Japan.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri: 9:30 AM - 5:30 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Easily accessible by roads, Kozhippara Falls are situated on the borders of Kakkadampoyil on the Malappuram -Calicut District divide. Providing a stunning sight, these falls are best known for its friendliness to swimmers and trekkers.

Lying in the Western Ghats of Kozhikode district in Kerala, Thusharagiri Fall cascades down as three waterfalls. Located in a small tribal village, the name of the falls means ???snow covered mountains'.

Meandering along the rocky terrain is a tributary of River Chaliyar called Kanjirapuzha. This water body forms many beautiful waterfalls and brooks at various points of its journey, which is a treat to your eyes.

Situated 60 km off Kozhikode, the Peruvannamuzhi Dam is a beautiful place surrounded by verdant greenery. The reservoir here offers speed boat and row boat ride across the 'Smaraka Thottam' - a garden built in the memory of freedom fighters in the region.
Another idyllic village off Calicut, Payyoli is famous for its beach that passes through the sea. One will also find a famous Trikkottur Perumalpuram Temple located there dedicated to Lord Shiva.

Kakkayam is a dam site located in Kozhikode of Kerala state surrounded by lush greenery.The distance is about 15 km from Kakkayam Bus stop. 'Orakkuzhi' is a waterfall located just after the Dam. Near the dam location, different animals including elephants can be seen.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week except Monday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Dedicated to the famous leader V.K. Krishna Menon, this museum chronicles several episodes from the freedom movement in India in parts.

Pazhassiraja Museum located on East Hill has been named after the great Pazhassiraja Kerala Varma of the Padinjare Kovilakom of the Kottayam Royal Family. The museum is famous for its various archaeological remains such as antique bronzes, ancient paintings and the historical umbrella stones etc.
Lying 7 km from Kozhikode, the Kerala Institute for Research, Training and Development of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes, is a museum that chronicles tribal lives of Kerala.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Located next to the light house on Kozhikode beach, this theme based amusement park for children is known for its thrilling rides and beautiful views of the sunset.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 3.30PM-8PM

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A popular hub to gorge on sweet delectables, the Sweet Street is one of the busiest place to shop in Kozhikode. It remains open till 9 in the night.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 5:00 AM - 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM - 9:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the Tali Temple is one of the oldest temples in the region. It is popular for its five different religious ceremonies performed every day. The Malayalam New Year is the best time to visit the temple.
Situated at Kuttichira in Kozhikode, this mosque can be traced back to 14th century. It has the capacity to accommodate around 1000 worshipers at a time.

Believed to be constructed around 700 years ago at Kuttichira, Mishkal Palli Mosque was named after Nakhooda Mishkal. He was an Arab merchant who established this mosque, which doesn't have any minarets making it unique.

This 13th century mosque with beautiful wooden carved ceilings and double tiled roofs is built in unique temple style of architecture. The mosque is well known as Sheikh Zainuddin Makhdoom II's mosque, who is the author of the famous book Tuhafat Ul Mujahideen.

Matri Dei Cathedral, built in Roman style of architecture is one among the older churches of Malabar. It traces back its history to 1513 AD and houses a 200-year old Portrait of St. Mary. It is also referred to as Mother of God Cathedral.

cityListData.cityIntro: Labeled as the 'City of Joy', the 'Cultural capital of India', Kolkata (formerly known as Calcutta) is a city with character and remnants of British Raj visible in its Victorian style architecture, trams and the nomenclature of the place.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost:
Garden: INR 10
Museum - Indians: INR 20 Foreigners: INR 200
School children up to 12 years age in uniform and army personnel in uniform: Free
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime:
Garden: 5:30 AM to 6:15 PM
Gallery: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM every day, except Monday and national holidays.
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Victoria Memorial is a large marble building, which is considered to be the pride of Kolkata. Built between 1906 and 1921, it is dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria. Presently it is a museum and a popular tourist spot under the Ministry of Culture.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit during pleasant weather, sunrise, sunset and favourable seasons amid day hours
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Fort William is a fort built in Kolkata on the eastern banks of the River Hooghly, the major distributary of Ganges, during the early years of the Bengal Presidency in the British India. It was named after King William III of England and Ireland and King William II of Scotland. The Maidan, which used to be a part of the Fort and is the largest urban park in Calcutta stands in front of the Fort.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Open 24 hours
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Located over the Hooghly river in West Bengal, Howrah Bridge or the Rabindra Setu is the main connection between Howrah and Kolkata. It is a cantilever bridge and is regarded as one of the busiest ones among them as it carries a daily traffic of over 100,000 vehicles and 150,000 pedestrians.

Belur Math is the headquarters of the Ramakrishna Math and Mission, founded by Swami Vivekananda, the chief disciple of Ramakrishna Paramahamsa. It is situated on the west bank of Hooghly River, Belur, West Bengal. It is one of the noteworthy establishments in Kolkata. This temple is the focus of the Ramakrishna Movement. The temple is prominent for its architecture that embraces Hindu, Christian and Islamic styles and stands as an icon of the unity of all religions.
This is the place where the Tomb of Mother Teresa is present. It is maintained by her missionaries and followers who have continued to promote her legacy.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Tue, Wed, Fri, Sun: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Marble palace near the Chorbagan in North Kolkata built in 1835 by Rajendra Mallick is famed for its art collection of masterpieces by Reuben and paintings by various renowned international artists such as Reynolds, Van Gogh and Rembrandt.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Indian visitor: INR 10 per head, </br>Foreign visitor: INR 150 per head
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Tuesday to Sunday:March to November: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM, </br>December to February: 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Indian Museum is one of the oldest museums of the world boasting some of the most exquisite collections of ornaments, fossils, skeletons, antiques, armours, mummies and stunning Mughal paintings.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit during pleasant weather, sunrise, sunset and favourable seasons amid day hours
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Birla Planetarium in Kolkata, West Bengal, is a single-storeyed circular structure designed in the typical Indian style, whose architecture is designed on the Buddhist Stupa at Sanchi. Situated at Chowringhee Road adjacent to the Victoria Memorial, St. Paul's Cathedral, and the Maidan in South Kolkata, it is the largest planetarium in Asia and the second largest planetarium in the world. There are two other Birla Planetariums in India B M Birla Planetarium in Chennai and the Birla Planetarium in Hyderabad.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 5:30 AM - 11:00 AM, 4:30 PM - 9:00 PM, All days open
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The glowing structure that adorns the streets of Kolkata is the popular Hindu Temple, Birla Temple. Dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha, the temple is the perfect specimen of craftsmanship.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost:
General Visitors : INR 40.
Organized Groups : INR 30
Organized School Groups : INR 20
Under Privileged Groups : INR 5.
There is separate entry fee for Space Theatre, Evolution Park, 3D theater,etc
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: One of its kind in India, the Science city was inaugurated on 1st July 1997. It is a major attraction for the residents of Kolkata as well as for the people visiting Kolkata. It is one of the finest and the largest science museums in the world and provides a fun way of learning science.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 10 AM _ã_ 5:30PM all days of the week

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Entry fee is charged according to the matches being played here
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Popular as the largest cricket stadium in India and the second largest in the world, the Eden Gardens can seat 66,000 spectators. It is set amidst an adjoining garden where Eden- related to the one-time Governor of Aukland and her sister would stroll during the evenings.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Other temples present here are Brahma, Shiva, Parvati, Ganesh, Kuber and Surya Temple etc. Another temple located 3 kms from town namely Kote-ke-mai Temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu has a large statue of him. The place is a must visit if spirituality
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Currently located on the Rabindra Bharati University campus in Jorasank, Jorasanko Thakur Bari is the house in which the first non-European Nobel laureate and poet, Rabindranath Tagore was born.

The erstwhile Dhakuri lake is an artificial tank spread over 75 acres and is home to various migratory birds from Siberia and Russia. The lake is surrounded by gardens, children's park an auditorium, making it a popular recreational spot perfect for idyllic picnics.
Designed, developed and maintained by Sabarrna Roy Choudhary Paribar Parishad to preserve and display the heritage of one of the well known families of Bengal- The Sabarna Roy Choudhary family.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week except on Sundays - 9 AM to 12 PM and 3 PM to 6 PM, On Sundays -7 AM - 6 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Said to be the first cathedral built in the overseas territory of the British Empire, St. Paul's Cathedral is a Anglican cathedral located in Kolkata. Also said to be the seat of the Diocese of Calcutta, the church was completed in 1847. The edifice now stands on the Cathedral Road on the 'Island of Attractions'. The church is said to be a very fine example of Indo-Gothic style of architecture.

Placed in the Chitpur area in the Burrabazar business district, Nakhoda mosque is one of the busiest Mosques of Kolkata and dates back almost a century. The prayer hall has a seating capacity of 10000, and the domes and minarets have been constructed in keeping with the Fatehpur Sikri style of architecture.

The Botanical Gardens of Calcutta were founded by Robert Kyd in 1787. Protected by the Botanical Survey of India, it stretches over 109 hectares. A Banyan tree in the garden, of more than 330 m circumference, known as The Great Banyan, is the largest tree in the world. The Botanic Gardens of Kolkata were later renamed Acharya Jagadish Chandra Indian Botanic Garden.
Kalighat Temple, one of the 51 Shakti Sthals of India, is one of the most visited Kali temples in India. The spot is where the toes of Sati's right foot fell during Shiva's Rudra Taandav naach.
The Shobhabazar Rajbari is one of the grandest Bengali style houses ever built. It was build by the Royal family of Shobhabazar in Kolkata, and the grandeur is only palpable to the eye.

One of the most secluded beaches of the country and one of the newest entrant in the tourism scene of West Bengal, Tajpur is slowly carving out a niche for itself as the stopover destination between the two major centers Digha and Shankarpur. The red crabs that are found here in plenty and the gentle breeze that lulls idle strolls by the sea make Tajpur a perfect place getaway.

cityListData.cityIntro: With beautiful paintings and peaceful serenity, Hemis envelops you in its calmness while the landscape adds to its pulchritude.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week between 6.00 am to 8.00 pm and closed between 12pm -2pm .
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: One of the wealthiest Tibetan monasteries, Hemis Monastery is located 45 km from Leh in Hemis, Ladakh. It is a Buddhist monastery of the Drukpa family situated in the foothill of Indus. It was re-established by the Sengge Namgyal (Ladakhi king). The monastery is well connected with motor-able roads.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: INR 20 for Indian; INR 100 for foreigners
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week- 6:30AM-5:30PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: At an altitude ranging from 3,300 m to 6,000 m above sea level, this sanctuary is known to be the highest in the world as well as the largest park of South Asia. It is also a habitat to the rare Snow Leopards.
A small shaky bridge over the Indus, leads one to the Stakna Gompa, on the banks of the river and looking out onto perhaps some of the most panoramic and beautiful views of Hemis.
A 45-minute walk away from the world, is a retreat centre above Hemis Gompa is a retreat centre called Gotsang Gompa.
In midst the snow peaked mountains and wrinkled terrains of Leh and Ladakh, Shang Gompa is a symbol of composure, tranquility, placidity and spending. The chanting of the monks is almost hypnotizing.
While at the Hemis Gompa, one might spot the Hemis Museum Shop. Be tempted to go inside and get your hands on the painting, wooden dragon statues, Curios, postcards and much more.

cityListData.cityIntro: Situated in the Sikar district of Rajasthan, Fatehpur is an ancient town, a prominent part of the Shekhawati region.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: This haveli used to be a property of the Deora family until 1999 when it was bought by a French artist called Nadine le Prince who modified and renovated the entire haveli and opened a cultural centre.

Fatehpur homes a number of beautifully done havelis which have been here since ancient times. The Jagannath Singhania Haveli belonging to the JK group showcases beautiful fresco work while the Geori Shankar Haveli is decorated with absolutely brilliant mirror work on the ceiling.
One of the most prominent temple in India dedicated to Sati, this temple sees pilgrims coming from all over the country.
With most temples established in ancient times, they are mostly visited as a part of a religious pilgrimage by pilgrims. You can pay a visit to the Dwarkadheesh temple and Balaji Dham.

cityListData.cityIntro: Wrapped in the interiors of West Bengal, in the Hooghly District, is the small yet significant town of Chandan Nagar. This small town could have been in place of present day Kolkata, had history gone as planned.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Owing to its French influences during the many years of French rule, this beautiful museum houses numerous French and British artifacts from the colonial rule.

Again made in French styles, the over 200 years old church is not just a stunning sight from outside, but is equally breath taking in the future. The white stone church looks even more stunning at sunset.
The beautifully sculpted temple was built back in 1740. One of the few temples in the area, the walls are covered with idols and carvings.
The Chandan Nagar strand is the most important and popular pathway in all of Chandan Nagar. The strand is built along the Ganges river, lined with trees and lights.
Another very unique and yet equally beautiful offering by Chandan Nagar, the Patal Bari literally means the underground house.
Chandan Nagar also has a lot of picnic spots to offer. But the most popular and biggest one is the KMDA Park. Built over a sprawling 33 acre piece of land, the place offers tens of picnic spots.

cityListData.cityIntro: Rajsamand is a small town in the state of Rajasthan situated 67 Km north of Udaipur with splendid lakes, exotic palaces, valuable historical significance.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Kankroli, a city located in the distict of Rajsamand in Rajasthan located about 68 km fron the north of Udaipur. Rajsamand Lake is a famous spot built by Maharaja Rajsingh is worth seeing there. Along the temple there exist the beautiful temple, Dwarkadheesh Temple devoted to Lord Krishna. the city is also famous for its JK Tyre Plant. JayKay Gram, the whole village is named after it.
Kumbhalgarh National Park, situated amidst the Aravali Range of Rajasthan in western India, surrounds the fort of Kumbhalgarh. Spread across a massive area of 608.5

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 10am-6pm. (Best time to visit- Oct-Mar.)
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText:
Haldighati is the pride of Rajsamand District. The place is known across the globe for the chivalrous deeds of the great Maharana Pratap. It is 44 kilometers from Udaipur.
It is nestled in the middle of the Aravali range. This narrow turmeric coloured mountainous region which played a stellar role in defending the honour of Mewar dynasty, is known as Haldighati.

cityListData.cityIntro: An idyllic village along the coastlines of the Arabian Sea, Kovalam is most famous for its three pristine beaches with shallow waters and low tidal waves where one can go surfing, wooden and motor boat riding.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Mainly known for its 35 m high lighthouse atop Kurumkal hillock, this beach offers are sandy walk and lip smacking sea food to its visitors.

Hawah is a stretch of isolated beach famous for its enchanting sunset views. Renowned as the second largest beach, it is also known as Eve's Beach for it being the first topless beach in India. However, topless bathing is banned now.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 12:00 AM - 12:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A large promontory separates this Northern beach from the southern side. Samudra Beach is where you can enjoy the sight of shoreline fishing and watch local fishermen ply their trade. There is also a mosque on this beach.
Primly sitting atop a rock on the beach, Haylcon Castle was built by Her Highness, The Queen of Travancore Maharani Sethu Lakshmi Bai as a private residence.

cityListData.cityIntro: A hill town in Western Ghats, apart from its strawberries, Mahabaleshwar is also well known for its numerous rivers, magnificent cascades and majestic peaks.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 9AM-6PM
All days of the week- 9:00AM-8:00PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Arthur's seat or Suicide point is also known as the Queen of all points. It offers the most mesmerizing and fascinating view of the dense valleys of Brahma-Arayana and the Savitri river.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week-6:00AM-8:00PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A wide plateau by the name of Wilson Point, tends to be one of the best places in the town to start your day. Catch a breathtaking view of the sunrise from any of the three watch points here. Enjoy the wide sceneries here as this also happens to be the highest points in the town.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit during pleasant weather, sunrise, sunset and favourable seasons amid day hours
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Venna lake is one of the major tourist attractions of Mahabaleshwar in Maharashtra state in India. The lake was constructed by Shri Appasaheb Maharaj, who was Raja of Satara. The lake is surrounded by trees on all sides. Tourists can enjoy a boat ride over the lake or a horse ride next to the lake. A number of small eateries line the banks of the lake. The Mahabaleshwar city market and the S T bus stand is about 2 kms from the lake and is apt for a walk during the day. Most tour operators include the Venna lake in their tours. Most buses, private vehicles stop at the Venna lake on their way to Mahabaleshwar when requested.
A visit to Mahabaleshwar is less or more incomplete without witnessing the tantalizing descend of the Chinaman's fall, one of the most significant falls in the state.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week-9:00AM-6:00PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: One of the highest view points of the town, this one stands out with some of the most widest and beautiful look outs.

These set of fascinating waterfalls connect Lodwick and Elphinston point and further join petit road with Old Mahabaleshwar road. Surrounded by greenery and rocks, these are ideal for a surreal experience amidst nature.

While in Mahabaleshwar, essentials include the freshest of strawberries and raspberries that the town is known for. Also take home jellies, honey, jams and more. One can also shop for handicrafts, leather items, Kolhapuri footwear and much more from the Town Bazaar.

Helen's point, also referred to as the Blue valley and is noted for its scenic beauty dotted by small huts, deep valleys and cascading waterfalls. Krishna river flowing through the heart of the area is the main attraction along with Robbers cave, Gavalani point and North Coat point.

The Falls lie on the Mahabaleshwar-Pune road. The stream here, in the fall, precipitates over the face of steep cliff, unbroken when the torrent is swollen by rain but otherwise, ordinarily divided by projecting rocks about one third of the way down into thin silver streaks and sprays often circled by rainbows. This is what makes the Lingmala Falls unique. One can also visit the Dhobi Waterfalls and Chinaman's Waterfalls in Mahabaleshwar. July to December is the best time to see the Lingmala Falls, when they're at their fullest.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 6AM - 8PM

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Pratapgad is a hill fort in Maharashtra. Situated close to the famous hill station of Mahabaleshwar in the district of Satara, the citadel rises to an elevation of about 3500 feet from the ground.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 6AM-12:30 PM& 5PM to 8PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Situated at a distance of 6km from the main city of Mahabaleshwar, the Mahabali or Mahabaleshwar temple is an ancient shrine and an example of the Maratha heritage. The temple is guarded by a five feet wall and is divided into two sections. The inner part has Shiva as the presiding deity. The site has two more temple nearby the Atibaleshwar temple and Panchganga temple.

Owing its name to the five hills that surround the town, is Panchgani, less than half an hour way from Mahabaleshwar. Comprising of many exotic colonial British structures, Parsi houses, natural beauty, boarding schools, the nearby town is known for its clean and fresh air making it an ideal holiday spot for tourists looking forward to refreshing and soothing their souls.

Yet another captivating sight in the town is the Morarji Castle is built in colonial British style of architecture. A drive around the place and you can view some of the most exotic colonial structures.

The second highest peak in the hills is located on the old Mahabaleshwar road offering a winning view of the Venna lake & Krishna valley. The peak was renamed as Connaught after the Duke of Connaught found himself in complete awe and admiration of the area.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Daytime
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Tapola is a satellite village of Mahabaleshwar about 25 Kms down the valley. Famed as the 'Mini Kashmir' Tapola is an ideal destination for a back to nature experience. Jungle treks from Tapola is very popular with trekkers. There are many unknown forts in the dense forest around the lake in Tapola like Vasota and Jaygad. The view of these forts and forest nearby is magnificent in itself. There are many strawberry farms and nurseries of Gerberra around Tapola. Boating in the Shivsagar lake is also a crowd attraction.

Bombay Point is located alongside Mumbai-Goa highway, and offers enticing views of the sunset. Ideal for afternoon picnic spot, people flock here in groups or as couples to spend some relaxed and enjoyable time, fascinated by all that??s around.

The natural thermal spring near River Savitri, it is believed to be infused with spiritual powers. A 10 minute walk away from the Arthur's point, the shallow waters are ideal to experience and spend a solitary relaxing time amidst natures gift.

cityListData.cityIntro: Tarkarli is famous for its long and narrow stretch of beach, with its pristine water, white sand, and of course Singhudurg, Maharashtra's popular sea fort

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Anytime
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Known for its many beaches, Tarkarli is an instance of paradise for beach lovers. With countless beaches such as Tarkarli, Kolam, Achra, you could spend your whole day walking and lazing around and enjoying the various adventurous sports available.What makes the beaches truly magical are the occasional sighting of dolphins. Achra beach also has a 260-year-old Rameshwar temple.
Water activities off the Tarkarli beach are much sought-after by visitors. Dolphin spotting, Scuba and snorkeling at tarkarli are especially popular attractions.

The area hosts beautiful views of backwaters and the Karli river meeting the Arabian sea near the Karli creek. The boat ride up the river is swift and the water hides the turmoil within which can only be spotted if a Dolphin comes up. The banks of the river is covered by dense forest
It is a beautiful place for lovers who can go for boat rides in the still, calm water. It is known for its crystal clear waters and one can see the sea bed on a clear weather day.

Famously as God's garden, this one is a rather outgrown village. It comprises of a vast community of Hindu fishermen who at times replace their fishing activities with tourism and giving their boats on rents for sea tours.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: INR 50 per person for Indians, INR 200 per person for foreign tourists
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 10:00 AM - 5:30 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Sindhudurg fort is one of the most sought after histrionics in Tarkarli. It was built by the great Maratha warrior, Chhatrapati Shivaji.
Build on Sindhudurg fort by Shivaji's son Rajaram. It is a temple of Shivaji Maharaj. You can also find his foot and palm prints on a lime preserved slab on the tower near Dilli Gate.
While in Tarkarli one can take home some Aam Papad, Amba Wadi, Cashew Bars and more.

cityListData.cityIntro: A culturally diversified and enriched with spirituality and heritage, Guntur is a civil center of Andhra Pradesh.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionName: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam and Ethipothala Falls
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: An exquisite sight of a massive irrigation project constructed over River Krishna, Nagarjuna Sagar Dam is situated around 100 miles from the city of Guntur.

A place situated about 16 miles from Guntur is packed with a famous holy shrine and site of great historic importance. The place itself is named after a renowned temple lying in the area namely Amareswara Swamy which inhabits Swayambhu Linga.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Daytime
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Mangalagiri means The Auspicious Hill. This place is one of the 8 important Mahakshetrams (sacred places) in India. The eight places where Lord Vishnu manifested himself. Thotadri is the present Mangalagiri. Lakshmi Devi has done tapas on this hill. That's why it got this name (The auspicious hill). There are three Narasimha Swamy temples in Mangalagiri. One is Panakala Narasimha Swamy on the hill. Another one is Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy at the foot of the temple. Third one is Gandala Narasimha Swamy at the top of the hill.

The city of Guntur is comprised of its own downtown area, midtown and residential areas. This place is packed with myriad of tourist attractions which include Center of Brodipet, Arundelpet, Jinnah Tower Center, Naaz Center, Brindavan Gardens, Old Guntur and Inner and Outer Ringroads.
A place to admire large number of endangered species of Birds, Uppalapadu Nature Conservation is situated in the southern side of the city.

Kondaveedu is a place lying about 17 miles from Guntur city adorned with one of the most popular tourist attractions of the region. It houses an ancient fort belonging to 14th century AD built by Reddy kings which comprises of 21 magnificent structures.

Situated in the south-west part of the city, Viswa Nagar can be easily approached via a National Highway 5 i.e. GNT-Chennai Expressway. The place is renowned for Universal Integration Pillar and Viswayogi Viswamji.
Krishna Barrage or Prakasam Barrage lies 18 miles from the city of Guntur. It is constructed over Krishna River all the way connecting Guntur with Krishna District.
Originally known as Kondakavuru, this place is famously known as Kotappakonda or Trikutaparvattam meaning three peaked hill which actually lies nearby.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: January
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Mid-January is considered as an important time in the Tamil calendar. The harvest festival, Pongal, typically falls on the 14th or the 15th of January and is celebrated in an exemplary mode of 'Tamil Culture'. Guntur has a lavish celebration of Pongal, that anybody interested in observing local cultures, should not miss.

cityListData.cityIntro: Dispur is a beautiful capital city of Assam packed with panoramic views, unique traditions and rich tribal culture.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Sualkuchi, located 24 km from Guwahati is a place famous for its Muga Silk. It is a special king of silk golden in colour which is only found in Assam.
A trip to Assam State Museum will take you to a journey of the states beautiful past and rich heritage. The museum offers an enriching experience and can be visited on all days except Monday.

Located on the top of Neelachal Hill, Kamakhya Temple is a place of great spiritual importance. Regarded as one of the Shakti Peethams, this temple is said to be linked with Goddess who is believed to have killed Narakasur, the devil king and ruler of ancient Assam.

Guwahati Planetarium one of the best astronomical research centers in whole north east region of the country. Installed with advanced technology from Japan i.e. Japanese Goto GX software and hardware, the planetarium organizes regular shows, seminars and workshops for visitors.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionName: Assam State Zoo and Botanical Gardens
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Enriched with flora and fauna, Assam State Zoo and Botanical Gardens is a place blessed with bounty of nature. Located on RGB Road or fondly known as Zoo Road, the Zoo inhabits some of the rare species of bird found only in North-East India as well as animals like leopards, white tiger and African and Indian rhinos.

Uma Nanda Temple is an ancient temple dating back to 17th century. Established by King Gadapani of Ahom, it is dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is located on a small picturesque Brahmaputra River isle also known as Peacock Island and houses the endangered golden Langurs.
Basistha Ashram is a place which is believed to be established by the three wives of Basistha sage and is located at the confluence of the three rivers namely: Sandhya, Kanta, Lalita.

An ancient temple located at the top of Shukaleswar Hill in Guwahati, it is believed to be created in 10th century and reconstructed in 17th century. This temple apart from its religious importance is also known for its distinct style of architecture.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime:
Mon-Fri : 4 am-9pm,Sat : 4 am-9 pm, Sun :4 am-9pm, Public holidays : 4 am-9 pm.
Best time to visit with family: Nov, Dec

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A famous temple of Dispur, Ugro Tara Temple is dedicated to Goddess Tara. Devotees visit the temple to worship the Goddess who presides here not in the form of idol but a well filled with water.
Regional Science Center and Museum is a perfect place for students and enthusiastic kids offering interactive sessions on science, life in pre-historic age, education and many other topics.

A visit to this institute is a vividly enriching experience where one can witness the fascinating culture of Assam; learn about the life of Assamese people and numerous tribes and groups of the state.

One of the major rivers of Asia, Brahmaputra is famous for an evening cruise amid spellbinding surroundings. Originating in southwest of Tibet, the river makes its entry in India through gorges of Himalayas and into Arunachal Pradesh.

Dispur being the capital city offers many local markets and bazaars offering almost all the daily use items to luxury goods. One can also find many malls located in Dispur as well as Guwahati located quite near to the city.

cityListData.cityIntro: If you wish to have the perfect beach getaway that doesn't include ear ripping music or just alcohol laden evenings, Bakkhali is the place to be.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Bakkhali Beach is perhaps the most breath taking beaches in India. The near 7 km coastline is not just the most stunning view of the sea merging into the land, but is also very sparsely populated, which accentuates its beauty.
Henry's Island is not just very famous in Bakkhali but is very popular throughout the country. The place derives its name from a British explorer who arrived on the island back in the 19th century.
Another very beautiful and elusive spot in Bakkhali, Jambu Dwip is an independent island, 8 km off the main coast. The island is uninhabited and submerges in water for some months of the year.

The Crocodile Park in Bakkhali is the only crocodile reservation park in West Bengal and one of the few in the world. Bakkhali Breeding centre has a huge collection of crocodiles, with a variant in almost every stage of life from the birth to old age.
Bishhalaxmi Temple is a little known Hindu Temple on Bakkhali Beach. The small and quaint place is yet another example of the peaceful yet stunning beauty Bakkhali seems to be full off.

The area of Fraserganj is popular because of some ancient history. Lord Fraser, a British Official resided in this area. He was so mesmerized by the place that he decided to build it up, but the construction he undertook never got completed, owing to the sea.

cityListData.cityIntro: Kodaikanal is the most sought after honeymoon destination in South India because of its scenic beauty and it has the attribute to leave any nature lover mesmerized by its charisma.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Kodai Lake that lays in the heart of Kodaikanal, is a star shaped man made lake that is draped on an area of 60 acres. Boating, horse riding, cycling and angling are a few of the adventure activities tourists can appease themselves with, near the lake.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Green Valley View, or the otherwise known Suicide Point, is a magnificent spot in Kodaikanal, popular mainly for its enroute fun. One must walk through misty woodlands and panoramic walks to reach this heaven like spot.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 9:30 AM - 4:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The famous Pillars Rocks of Kodaikanal are located around 8 km from the lake and are an exquisite picnic spot. Constituting of a beautiful mini garden, the place is so named as it has three vertically positioned boulders reaching up to a height of 400 feet.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 9AM-3PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Berijam Lake is a reservoir near Kodaikanal town in Dindigul district of Tamil Nadu. It is at the old site of "Fort Hamilton", in the upper Palani hills.The lake, created by a dam with sluice outlets, is part of a micro_ã_watershed development project. The lake_ã_s water quality is excellent.The lake is open for visitors from the month of october to may.The lake is rich in flora and fauna and is an untouched beauty of nature.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: An amount of ruppees 10 per person and ruppee 2o for telescope house .
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of week between 7.00 am - 7.00pm .
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Coakers walk is an one killometer long built on the mountain. It was constructed in 1872, by Lt Coaker. It is about 1/2 Km away from the Kodai and is constructed on the steep slope of mountains. The outlook of the path defines the beauty of the nature i.e mountains, valleys, cities etc. Telescope house is must watch of the coakers walk. People are allowed to ride bicycles.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 9:30 AM - 5:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: One of the most popular botanical gardens in Kodaikanal, the Brayant Park is known for its fauna, rafts and hybrids. The best time to visit this marvelous park is during the annual horticulture show that is held during the month of May.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 10AM-6PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Bear Shola Falls, located at a distance of 2 km from the Kodaikanal Lake, is another popular tourist spot within the destination. Owing to the fact that in earlier days bears used to come to this fall for drinking water; thus, the falls has got its name as Bear Shola Falls.

Kurunji Temple is mainly dedicated to Lord Murugu and is dexterously based at a distance of 3 km from the lake. Providing delightful views of small villages, Palani Hills and Northern plains, and carrots plantation on the terraced slopes, the temple is also associated with the Kurunji Flower which blooms once in 12 years carpeting the whole area with purple flowers.
Silent Valley View is located in close proximity to the Pillar rock garden in Kodaikanal. The point is famous for proffering some astounding and stunning views of the Silent Valley.

Dolphin's Nose in Kodaikanal is a rustic and natural prodigy that features a flat rock protruding over a chasmal height of 6600 feet. Located almost 8 km from the main city center, this point offers breath taking views of the surrounding.

The perfect stop over in-between a long journey, these silver cascade falls demand your attention while you travel from Kodaikanal till Madurai. The Silver Cascade Falls formed as a result of the over flowing of the famous man-made Kodai Lake, are the perfect way to have a break while on a long road trip. One can also take a swim in the waters of the waterfall provided the temperature is right.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 10.00 am to 6.00 pm (Mon to Sat)(Best time to visit September to May)

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A trekkers delight, Kodaikanal has some exquisite locations to offer to both the professional trekkers and the novice ones. Trekking routes with varying difficulty levels are present and a tourist can select the route according to the fitness, time factor and one's trekking ability.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 5:00 AM - 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM - 9:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: At a distance of 65 km from Kodaikanal lies the holy Subramanya temple, also known as Kartikeya Temple. Dedicated to Lord Subramanya, the temple is located at a height of 135 meters and the pilgrim needs to undertake a 659 step climb to reach the temple.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Devil's Kitchen, which lays in between the Green Valley View and Pillar rocks, is a deep cleft that strikes to one as a small gutter. The Devils Kitchen is however, an extremely dangerous deep fall.

The Kodaikanal Solar Observatory is a solar observatory owned and operated by the Indian Institute of Astrophysics. It is located 4 km from Kodaikanal town, Dindigul district in Tamil Nadu. The Evershed effect was first detected at this observatory in January 1909. Solar data collected by the lab is among the oldest in India. Precise observations of the equatorial electrojet are made here due to the unique geography of Kodaikanal.
If visitors have some extra time, they can also visit Chettiyar Park, Kodaikanal Golf Club, Lutheran Church, Pambar Falls, Shembaganur Museum of Natural History, Bison Wells.

cityListData.cityIntro: Mashobra is a lush green expanse in Himachal Pradesh, tucked away at a height of about 7700 feet, ensuring minimal human obstruction in the course of nature to provide you with the most pure and liberating experience of your lifetime.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Craignano is an extremely spectacular tourist destination attracting maximum crowd of all visitors in Mashobra. It is located at a height of about 7700 feet.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Third Tuesday of May
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: If you're a big fan of exploring little known traditions and festivals, you might consider visiting the Mahasu Peak in the month of May. The festival, known as Mahasu Jatara, falls on the third Tuesday of May, celebrates the shifting of the idol of the chief deity Lord Mahasu.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 9am-6pm
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: If you come to Mashobra, you just do not miss one of Asia's largest watersheds, supplying water to Shimla. The Reserve Forest Sanctuary is a must visit not only for being popular in the continent, but for the lush coniferous cover surrounding it, but also because it is a birdwatcher's delight.

Originally built as a residence of Lord Kitchener of Khartoum, this building is said to have been a favourite retreat of Lord Ripon. However, the building got burnt in 1993 and a new Wildflower building was built as a hotel there by joint venture between HP government and Oberoi group of Hotels.

cityListData.cityIntro: Famous for its natural heritage,  Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve is definitely one of India?s most exciting and best protected Tiger Reserve, with most visible tiger sightings in the state of Maharashtra

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: INR 20 per person, INR 50 per vehicle, INR 2 still camera, INR 100 video camera, INR 100 guide fee
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week except Tuesday: 6:00 AM - 11:00 AM, 2:00 PM - 6:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Perched at a height of 200m, the national park is the oldest in Maharashtra and is considered to be the second tiger reserve of the state. It is divided into two major zones, namely the Tadoba National park(1955) and Andhari wildlife sanctuary (1986).
The lake is located in the middle of the Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve. Around 200 species of birds are found near the lake, including the water birds.

Another village whose border also serves as an entry gate for the Moharli zone of the Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve. It is located at a distance of around 6.9 km from the Tadoba region. One can also avail Jungle safari facility from the entry gate of this region.

The Erai dam is situated across river Erai and is a gravity filled dam. It is 1620m in length and 30 m above the lowest foundation in height. The water storage capacity and volume content of the Erai dam are 226, 500 cu km and 985 cu km, respectively.
One might not find any elaborate shopping options here.

cityListData.cityIntro: Blessed with a vast expanse of green cover, beautiful rolling hills, wandering streams and gurgling waterfalls; Peermede is a small bewitching hill station of Kerala.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A destination perfect for long walks and mindless strolling, Thrissanku Hills are located just 4 km from Peermede. Misty hills, splendid views and lovely breeze give this place a new charm.

If you are looking for a beautiful trekking trail or an ideal spot for picnic, Peeru Hills is just the right place. The place is named after the sufi saint Peer Mohammed who was here in his last days.

Offering breath taking sights from the top, Grampi is situated nearly 5 km from Peermede. It is also referred to as Parunthupara (eagle rock) and is said to be adorned with amazing trekking trails along with panoramic surroundings, rocky terrain, a stretch of green forests and beautiful hillsides.

Located 17 km from Peermede, Pattumala comprises of several attractions including rolling peaks, beautiful tea gardens and small streams. The place houses two tea gardens namely AV Thomas and Co. and Harrisons Malayalam.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time : Apr-Jun, Sep-Nov
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Wagamond situated at ana elevation of 1100 m above the sea level, Wagamon is a trekker's paradise. Located at a distance of 25 kms from Peermede, the place is flanked by never ending tea gardens, sprawling meadows and valleys, an admiring piece of art.
Sahyadri Ayurvedic Center is a hospital which offers Ayurvedic treatments to its patients and is managed by the Peermede Development Society in Pallikunnu.

The town offers several beautiful and challenging trails for the lover of adventurous activities. Peeru Hills, Grampi, Vagamon, Memala and Karandakapara Hills are some of the most popular trails in Peermede.
Peermede is a lush green picturesque town where, coffee, tea and cardamom is grown in abundance. Make sure you take some varieties of each product back home to savor the flavors of the town later.

cityListData.cityIntro: 70 kms off Delhi and at 190 m altitude, the historical city of Nuh traces its roots to the Aryan civilization, and later the Tughlaq Dynasty.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A fine blend of Muslim and Rajput style of architecture, Sheikh Musa is famous for its shaking minarets of the Tomb of Sheikh Musa. This man-made marvel is also known for its brilliant engineering techniques such as - if a person shakes one pyramid, the other person can feel the vibrations in the next one.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionName: Chui Mai Pond and Water Tank
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: With floral carvings and chattris (cenotaphs) in Redstone, this ancient tank in Nallad is a natural reservoir and a sight to behold.

Close to Sheikh Musa is the Temple of Hathor which is believed to be of the Third Dynasty of Tuthmosis of Egypt. A number of Greek and demotic papyri were found by archaeologists in the temple complex.

Lying 7 km off Nuh is the village of Kotla famous for its ancient ruins. As per folklore, the Pandavas stopped here for a brief period in the Shiva temple during their 14 year long exile on the way from Hastinapur.

cityListData.cityIntro: With close to 40 look-out points offering great sunrise and sunset views in the smallest hill station in India with, Matheran clearly wins on the rejuvenating experience it provides to visitors.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: To enjoy the spectacular view of the city and the remains of Prabal and Vishalgad fort, this place is a must visit. Lion's head is another attraction nearby.

Panorama Point, also reckoned as the Sun Rise Pointm is a much admired vantage point near Matheran. Located at the significant distance from the Matheran Market, Panorama Point is commended as the greatest capacious space on any mount peak near Matheran. It is profoundly cherished as the perfect point to view the of the rising sun from. People gather up at the Panorama Point before the break of day to capture the majestic play of colors.

Matheran, a Hill Station and a municipal council in the Raigad district of Maharashtra placed in Karjat Tahsil and is also the smallest hill station in India. It is located on the Western Ghats range at an elevation of around 800 m above sea level. It is located around 90 km from Mumbai, and 120 km from Pune. Matheran's authority over many metropolitan cities makes it a popular weekend destination for urbans. Matheran, which means "forest on the forehead" of the mountains, is an eco-sensitive region, declared by the Ministry of Environment and Forest, Government of India. It is Asia's only vehicle-free hill station.
Close to the market, like other points, this one too provides a great view. Close to the point is Prabalgad fort which can be seen from here.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Morning and evening. Though best time to visit is during rain but only for youngsters because it is very slippery and difficult for elderly to walk. During rain (near mumbai) this place is even better than Khandala.
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Matheran a Hill Station and a municipal council in the Raigad district in the Indian state of Maharashtra, is a hill station in Karjat Tahsil and is also the smallest hill station in India. Matheran, which means "forest on the forehead" (of the mountains) is an eco-sensitive region, as declared by the ministery of Environment and Forest, Government of India, is a popular weekend getaway for urban residents and Asia's only automobile-free hill station.
Also known as the Sharlott lake, this one simply provides a picturesque view with lush green surroundings. Echo point & Louisa point are other attractions around this place.

One Tree Hill, as the name suggests, has just one tree on the hill top, when all other surroundings nearby have dense forest cover. One of the most recommended points in Matheran, the view from the Point is hence very unique. On a clear day, the view is said to be almost breathtaking, with the entire valley of Matheran lying below one's feet. Since many visitors don't bother with the exertion of climbing up a hill for just another view, the hill is less chaotic as compared to others and hence provides great peace and serenity to those whoe decide upon it.

Matheran is a small hill station in Maharashtra, a very peaceful place in the lap of the Sahyadris, located away from the noise and hustles of the other parts of Maharashtra. Unlike most of the other lookout points, Alexander Point is at a close proximity from where tourist resorts are, and thus the easiest to reach early in the morning, which is the best time to enjoy the scenaries around the point.
One of the most loved spots of the town, watches over some beautiful views and sceneries.
One of the most famous picnic spots of the region, the place provides a spectacular view of Karjat and Khandal, the nearby towns
A honeymoon destination to a Britishers and the Parsis, back in history, its only natural for this one to be called Honeymoon Hill.
While only the remains and ruins of the structure can be seen, this one find itself wrapped in a fain historic charm. The for had itself captured by Shivaji Maharaj from the Mughals.
A very soothing & relaxing atmosphere about the place makes it an ideal choice. The place is heart shaped.
Downhill from One tree hill, the steps are in the shape of a ladder that mange to challenge even the most ardent of trekkers.
This one is known for the horse race course it houses.
While here, one can shop for leather items, Kolhapuri footwear, Chikki, honey and simple handicraft items here. One can head to the Mall road for their shopping spree.

cityListData.cityIntro: Khamman has a great historic value in Andhra Pradesh because of the Khammam fort that has seen different rulers and reigns in different times.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: According to legends, the Narsimha Swami or Narsimhadri temple, situated on a hill called Stambhadri, is said to have existed since 1.6 million years.

Initiated in 950 AD and completed by the year 1000, this fort has seen many change of reigns. Depicting architecture of both Muslim and Hindu reigns, Khammam Fort has recently completed 1000 years of existence and is a major tourist destination.

Jammalapuram is a quaint village situated near Yerupallam, a town in Khammam district. This village housed many temples but the main temple is of Swami Venkateshwara, who's the presiding deity of the village.
The Palair lake is situated in the Palair Village, located 30 km from Khammam town. It is a man-made lake and major a source of fresh water to the Khammam district.
This place is famous for clothes and accessory shopping.
This the main market for Jewellery trade.

cityListData.cityIntro: A well liked tourist town, Kailashahar was once the capital of a kingdom and evidence of its royal history can be seen here.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Dedicated to Lord Krishna, this temple was installed by Krishnanada Sevayet. It has monumental value today
The 14 deities' temple is dedicated to Ama or Tripuri, the mother of the people of Tripura. It is situated atop a tortoise shaped hill with the Lake Kalyansaga to its eastern side.
Traditionally grown tea can be seen on these tea estates along with organic tea. These plantations date back to 1916.

The central Shiva head is a rock cut carving of a height of 30 feet, including a headdress of 10 feet. A female figure and Goddess Durga are seen on the headdress. This carving is part of the multiple carvings and sculptures on the hill.

cityListData.cityIntro: Situated along the holy Ganges, Haridwar is famous for its temples and ghats where pilgrims bathe to relieve themselves of their sins.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Ganga Aarti in Hardwar is performed at the Har-ki-Pauri Ghat, which was built in the 1st century by King Vikram. In the evening, as the sun's last rays reflect off the boundless waters of the river Ganga, people start gathering for the Aarti. This divine light ceremony is filled with songs and prayers, rituals and a palpable sense of divinity. During this beautiful ceremony, dias or oil lamps are offered to God. Aarti can be done to a deity in the temple, or on the banks of the Ganga, or it can be performed to a saint. The aarti is organised twice a day, every morning at sunrise and every evening at sunset.
Regarded as one of the most scared Ghats in Haridwar and India, Har Ki Pauri is visited by devotees and visitors in large number seeking the blessings of Holy Ganga by offering their prayers.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 7AM-7PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: dedicated to Chandi Devi, the temple is located on the top of neel parvat on the eastern summit of sivalik hills, the southern most chain of the himalyas. It was built in 1929 by the king of kashmir. The temple is a very famous pilgimage and gathers devotees all around the year. Because of its location the Chandi Devi temple also prefered choice of trekking tourists.

One of the famous Siddhapeeths atop Shivalik Hills, the temple dedicated to the companion of Nag King Vasuki, Goddess Manasa, this is another temple believed to grant devotees wishes. Mansa Devi temple is one vertex of the Siddhapeeth triangle formed by Chandi Devi and Maya Devi temples.

A famous temple in Kankhal, Haridwar Daksha Mahadev Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. This temple becomes a centre of attraction in the month of Sawan when all the devotees flock to the temple to worship.

Famous for having hosted 7 great sages- Kashyapa, Vashishta, Atri, Vishwamitra, Jamadagi, Bharadwaja and Gautam, this ashram is well known for its tranquil atmosphere ideal for meditation. It is also believed that Ganga split herself into seven currents at this spot.
A replica of the Vaishno Devi temple in Kashmir, the temple is marked by tunnels and caves that leads to the inner sanctum containing the shrine of Goddess Vaishno Devi.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit during the morning and evening 'Aarti'.
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Maya Devi Temple is a Hindu temple dedicated to goddess Maya in the holy city of Haridwar of Uttarakhand state in India. It is believed that the heart and navel of goddess Sati fell in the region where the temple stands today and thus it is sometimes referred to as a Shakti Peetha. (br) Goddess Maya is the Adhisthatri deity of Haridwar. who is a three-headed and four-armed deity, believed to be an incarnation of Shakti. Haridwar was previously known as Mayapuri in reverence to this deity. The temple is a Siddh Peetha which are the places of worship where desires get fulfilled. It is one of three such Peethas located in Haridwar, the other two being Chandi Devi Temple and Mansa Devi Temple.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 5AM-9PM

toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Other places to visit in Haridwar are Gau Ghat, Gaurishankar Mahadev Temple, Kamraj-ki-Kali Temple, Kanva Rishi Ashram, Kushavarta Ghat, Pavan Dham, Shravanathji's Temple, Vishnu Ghat, Moti bazar

Being primarily a pilgrimage destination, Haridwar has numerous shops along its streets selling all essentials that a pilgrim would need. Bada Bazar in Haridwar is great place to shop for wooden items and handicrafts.
Local shops in Haridwar sell all the essentials that a pilgrim would need.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: INR 150 per person for Indians, INR 600 per person for foreign tourists, INR 50 per still camera
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Spread across 249 sq km east of Ganges, the wildlife sanctuary is home to small cats, tigers, elephants and bears apart from various birds.

cityListData.cityIntro: Kullu, a popular tourist destination generally coupled with Manali, is an open valley with panoramic views and majestic hills covered with Deodar and Pine trees.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 6:00 AM-8:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The oldest temple in the valley is a place of much festivity and color around and during Dussera and even otherwise assumes much religious importance amongst the locals.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 6:00 AM- 8:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: This is the one temple in Kullu that you cannot miss. From a legend where lightning strikes, to a huge structure and surreal surroundings with some of the best views and sceneries of Kullu, the temple is enchanting in every bit.
This man-made marvel stands out from much of nature's picture perfect valleys and hills around it, with a rather spectacular and grand experience to offer to its viewer.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Domestic Adult: 50 RsForeigner: 200 Rs.( Separate charges for camera use)
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit : From April to June and October-November
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Great Himalayan National Park, situated in Himachal Pradesh has four valleys named Sainj Valley, Tirthan Valley, Jiwa Nal Valley and Parvati Valley. They are all popular for their natural and scenic beauty. The park has exotic species of flora and fauna. The park was established in 1984.

The River Beas in Kullu, is popular for rafting of all grades of rapids, for amateurs, tourists as well as trained and professional rafters. End of April to June and September to October are the best months for rafting in Kullu. Avoid the monsoons and the winters if you want to go for Rafting here.
Trout Fishing is quiet popular in the Kullu Valley. There are a number of spots fro fishing along the river Tirthan, such as Kasol, Naggar, Katrain and Raison.

Regarded as one of the most challenging treks in northern Himalayan region, Parvati Valley Base Camp Trek is perfect for those seeking adventure. The mesmerizing views all around will not only leave spell bound by its beauty but also gushing with adrenaline with the challenges it throws at you at every nook and corner.

Like any other sacred shrine or temple in the area, this one too finds itself a picture perfect backdrop. Watching over valleys from the top of a hill, the temple dedicated to Hindu Goddess Mata Hanogi, has a stream running down below, creating the perfect scenery for a religious and sacred structure.

Thousands of pilgrims come here every year to pay homage to Lord Shringa, who is the ruling deity of Banjar valley. The temple houses an idol of Shringa Rishi along with goddess Shanta in the temple. It is at small distance from the town of Kullu.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit during pleasant weather, sunrise, sunset and favourable seasons amid day hours
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Dolphins are occasionally spotted here. Coconut groves that line this place are a vision.

Manikaran is a small town situated between rivers Parvati and Bears, famous for its hot water springs and beautiful landscapes. The town has many temples and a gurudwara, making it a significant pilgrimage centre for Hindus and Sikhs alike.

What is generally overlooked as a town of utility only, with an airport and the last ATM before you travel to higher altitudes, is a town where one can have a calm, simple and almost idle break from the popular Himachal hill stations and their tourist rush.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit: mid June to early October.
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Kullu valley of Himachal Pradesh and its surrounding mountains are nestled in two beautiful and mighty ranges Pirpanjal and Dhauladhar. It is situated on the left bank of river Beas. The valley has fertile fields, evergreen thicket and crystal clear gushing waters. People from different parts of the country visit the place to enjoy the scenic beauty.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 6:00AM-7:00PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The temple is surrounded by an ancient legend of a shepherd boy who caught hold of one of the two girls dancing to the tune of his flute. She then revealed that she was a goddess and decided to settle in that village.

Kullu is a popular destination for those in search of a trek through mountains, valleys, streams and more. The treks here are usually at a high altitude, cover various terrains, some welcoming and some not so much, as well as some unexplored landscapes and sacred temples.

Naggar is an unexplored and modest town in the Kullu district, which will give you all the time to leisurely walk around, rest and rejuvenate amongst mountains, valleys, lush greenery and the River Beas flowing in much proximity.

One can shop for shawls, caps, jewellery, Thangka paintings, and a number of Tibetan souvenirs at the Tibetan Market. For more of traditional jewellery head to the Sultanpur Market. Other than these you will find a number of simple markets in and around tourist spots and temples.

cityListData.cityIntro: Situated close to the Pakistan Border, the Golden City is a major tourist spot owing to its proximity to the Thar Desert.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Indian: INR 30, </br>Foreigner: INR 70 </br>Still Camera: INR 50, </br>Video Camera: INR 150
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Jaisalmer Fort, nestled amid the golden sands of Thar Desert, is steeped with rich past and heritage. Displaying the brilliant craftsmanship, Jaisalmer Fort is one of the most renowned forts in the world.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 12:00 AM - 12:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Built in the 14th century, it was once the source of drinking water for the entire town of Bikaner. Now it has developed as a tourist spot with many temples and shrines surrounding the lake.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: for Indians, INR 10 per person for foreign tourists, INR 50 per still camera, INR 100 per camcorder
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: This group of beautiful temples within the Jaisalmer Fort walls have carved structures which depict pictures of sages, hermits, animals, etc. Built in the Dilwara style that is famous all over the world for its architecture, these temples are dedicated to Rikhabdevji and Shambhavdev Ji, the famous Jain hermits known as 'Tirthankaras'.
The city of Jaisalmer is famous for its rich heritage and culture and havelis are a major part of it. The Patwon-ki-Haveli is a famous Haveli situated about 10km from the Jaisalmer Fort.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Varied according to service providers/package opted for
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: In the midst of the soft golden sand, Jaisalmer evokes a vivid picture of sheer magic and the magical brilliance of the desert. Jaisalmer, known as the 'Golden City of Rajasthan' enjoys the glory of the majestic Jaisalmer Fort - a world renowned heritage site. Travelling to this desert town and experiencing the golden air, mountain-high sand dunes, magnificence of the Jain Temple's architecture, the renowned havelis and above all the jaislmer desert life style, through the specialized Desert Safaris provided in the area.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: All days of the week: 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: The Badal Palace has a cloud like appearance and has the Tazia Tower emerging from it. This tower is quite different from the usual Rajputana architecture of Rajasthan.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Rs 20-50  per person for Indians and Rs. 50-100  per person for foreign tourists
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: 8 AM - 6 PM all days of the week
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Bada Bagh in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan is primarliy a cenotaph adjoining a garden, located about 6 kms north of Jaisalmer, on the way to Ramgarh. The set of royal cenotaphs are basically chhatris of the Maharajas which once ruled the Jaisalmer state. The gardens are now largely neglected, but the hill with the cenotaphs is still quite an interesting sight in the middle of the sand dunes, forming a delectable sight for the eyes.

Desert National Park near Jaisalmer is a protected sanctuary which is considered to be one of the biggest national parks in India. A major part of the park is on a landscape, which consists of lakebed of extinct salt lakes and thorny scrubs and it is amusing to see how come living organisms flourish in the harsh conditions of the desert. If you want to explore the majestic wildlife at the Desert National Park then the best way to do so is by going for an adventure-filled jeep safari which will be an entirely new exciting experience.
Khuri, also known as Tilo Ki Dhani, is a natural hamlet in Thar Desert close to Jaisalmer. Renowned for sand dunes and vast stretch of sandbank, Khuri is an ideal place for camel safari.

Filled with vibrant colours, rich heritage and warm hospitality, Barmer is a small town representing the true reflection of Rajasthan all summed up in it. The sandy grounds of the town are lively and a must visit.

Knowledge bank of rich cultural heritage, craftsmanship and artistic talents of Jaisalmer, the museum displays varied collections of traditional instruments, rich collections of ancient and medieval coins, any kinds of utensils and other artifacts and admirable textiles.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time to visit : Pre monsoon
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: A rare desert area which lies just in the edge of Jaisalmer Desert National Park and is also rated as top 10 must see tourist destinations in Rajasthan by Lonely Planet & Tripadvisor, Sam Sand Dunes are a simply amazing. These dunes are 42-45 Kms away from the golden city (Jaisalmer) and has a nice sealed non-bumpy road which is maintained by Indian Arm forces. (br) Honestly speaking, these sand dunes are very much similar to Sahara desert. The best time to visit these dunes is either sunset (around 4-7 pm) or sunrise (4-6 am). There are many other activities which one may enjoy as camel safari and jeep safari.
India's largest operational onshore wind mill farm, Jaisalmer Wind Mill Park is located in Rajasthan near the Yamuna River between the Vindyha Mountains and the Himalayas.

cityListData.cityIntro: Famous for its exhibits of Hoysala architecture, Halebidu is a ruined city with a glorious past with a strikingly beautiful collection of temples, shrines and sculptures.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Best time during the Day hrs.
toDoAttractionsList.attractionsShortText: Hoysaleswara temple, also spelt Hoysaleshwara, is a temple dedicated to Hindu god Shiva. It was built in Halebidu Karnataka, during the rule of King Vishnuvardhana of the Hoysala Empire in the 12th century. The construction was started around 1120 CE and completed in 1150 CE. During the early 14th century, Karnataka was sacked and looted by Muslim invaders from northern India and the temple fell into a state of ruin and neglect. Previously known as Dorasamudra, Halebidu is 16 km from Belur, 31 km from Hassan and 149 km from Mysore, in the state of Karnataka, India.
The Jain temples here are famous for the highly polished pillars that resemble mirrors.

toDoAttractionsList.attractionCost: Free entrance, Government approved guides cost between INR 125 - INR 250
toDoAttractionsList.attractionOpenTime: Temple timings: 7:30 AM - 5:30 PM, </br>Inner sanctum of main deity stay closed between 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM, 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM, and 5:00 PM - 5:30 PM
